Method Detail

parseKickstartUrl

public java.util.Map parseKickstartUrl(java.lang.String url)
Parse a ks url and return a Map of options Example: "ks/org/3756992x3d9f6e2d5717e264c89b5ac18eb0c59e/label/kslabelfoo"; NOTE: This method also updates the KickstartSession.state field to "configuration_accessed"

Parameters:
url - to parse
Returns:
Map of options. Usually containing host, ksdata, label and org_id

isProxyRequest

public boolean isProxyRequest()
Check to see if this request came through a proxy

Returns:
boolean if proxied or not.

getKickstartHost

public java.lang.String getKickstartHost()
Get the kickstart host to use. Will use the host of the proxy if the header is present. If not the code then resorts to getting the cobbler hostname from our rhn.conf Config.

Returns:
String representing the Kickstart Host

getKickstartProtocol

public java.lang.String getKickstartProtocol()
Returns:
String representing the kickstart protocol.

getKickstartProtocolAndHost

public java.lang.String getKickstartProtocolAndHost()
Get the protocol plus the host: http://host1.rhndev.redhat.com

Returns:
proto plus host url

generateOrgToken

public java.lang.String generateOrgToken(Org org)
Parameters:
org - The Org to generate the token for.
Returns:
A session-specific token for the given Org.

generateKickstartUrl

public java.lang.String generateKickstartUrl(Org org,
                                             java.lang.String function)
Generates a URL suitable for downloading things related to a specific kickstart session.

Parameters:
org - The Org to generate the ks url for.
function - The function that will be appended to the returned kickstart url.
Returns:
A string suitable for downloading kickstart-related things.

verifyKickstartChannel

public boolean verifyKickstartChannel(KickstartData ksdata,
                                      User user)
Verify that the kickstart channel is valid. Valid kickstart channels must have a set list of packages described by KickstartFormatter.UPDATE_PKG_NAMES and KickstartFormatter.FRESH_PKG_NAMES_RHEL34 Also checks for auto-kickstart packages.

Parameters:
ksdata - kickstart data containing the kickstart channel.
user - The logged in user.
Returns:
Whether the kickstart channel is a valid one.

verifyKickstartChannel

public boolean verifyKickstartChannel(KickstartData ksdata,
                                      User user,
                                      boolean checkAutoKickstart)
Verify that the kickstart channel is valid. Valid kickstart channels must have a set list of packages described by KickstartFormatter.UPDATE_PKG_NAMES and KickstartFormatter.FRESH_PKG_NAMES_RHEL34 Non bare metal kickstarts also must have auto kickstart packages.

Parameters:
ksdata - kickstart data containing the kickstart channel.
user - The logged in user.
checkAutoKickstart - Whether or not to verify the existence of auto-kickstart files. These are needed for many tasks, but are not necessary for generating kickstart files.
Returns:
Whether the kickstart channel is a valid one.

createInvalidChannelMsg

public ActionMessages createInvalidChannelMsg(KickstartData ksdata)
Create a message to the user about having a kickstart channel that is missing required packages.

Parameters:
ksdata - The kickstart data that contains the kickstart channel.
Returns:
Messages to add to the request.
